resources.string: Parkrun organise free, weekly, 5km timed runs around the world. They are open to everyone, free, and are safe and easy to take part in.

string.name: parkrun_text4_2
string.i: "These events take place in pleasant parkland surroundings and we encourage people of every ability to take part; from those taking their first steps in running to Olympians; from juniors to those with more experience; we welcome you all."

resources.string: Type an athlete ID number\n(Can be found in your barcode and/or registration email)
The displayed distance is a straight line from your location to the tracks locations. Not the driving or walking distance
Adult £2.80, Junior £1.40.\n Monthly and quarterly track passes available.
400m all-weather track with 8 lanes. Resurfaced in 2011.
6-lane 386.8m cinder track with tight bends. Open at all times.
Adult £2.70.\n Track passes or memberships available.
400m 8-lane synthetic track, floodlit. There is also a 90m grass track at Hampstead Heath Extension during summer months.
Mon, Wed, Fri, Sat, Sun 10am-4pm\n Tue & Thu 4pm-9.30pm
White Hart Lane Community Sports Centre
Adult £4.40.\n Concession groups discount.\n Monthly passes available
8-lane 400m synthetic outdoor track. Plus a 600m bark trail and 200m indoor track with 130 sprint straight.
Adult £4.40.\n Concession groups discount.\n Monthly passes available
8-lane 400m synthetic outdoor track. Plus a 600m bark trail and 200m indoor track with 130 sprint straight.
Adult £3.70, Junior £2.10.\n Membership options available for reduced charges.\n 6 month season tickets available.

Open Mon–Wed 9am–4pm
 Tue 2–9pm; Thu 9am-9pm
 Fri 9am-12pm
 Sat-Sun Closed.
8-lane all-weather 400m running track. Plus indoor 110m track.
8-lane all-weather 400m running track. Plus indoor 110m track.
400m outdoor synthetic track plus 60m indoor sprint hall.
400m outdoor synthetic track plus 60m indoor sprint hall.
400m 8-lane synthetic track. Also has an 80m indoor track.
400m 8-lane synthetic track. Also has an 80m indoor track.
400m 6-lane synthetic track, floodlit. Also has a 132m indoor sprint track.
400m 6-lane synthetic track, floodlit. Also has a 132m indoor sprint track.

Our six-lane athletics track provides first-class running facilities in the centre of Southwark for people of all ages and abilities, no matter what your goals may be – whether it’s having fun or training for a marathon, while it’s easy to get to via public transport, too. (Please be aware that Tuesday and Thursday are club sessions whilst Saturday is available for public hire costing non-members £3 (adults) or £1.50 (concessions)).

This run along the Thames takes in some of the most popular sights London has to offer, including the Tower of London, Tower Bridge, the London Eye, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. It is completely flat and mainly along the waterfront thus avoiding some street traffic. This route is best run early in the morning or in the winter to avoid heavy tourist traffic. You’ll want to plan an easy run so you can take your time to enjoy the historic landmarks and stop for pictures. The distance can be varied by selecting a different bridge to cross the river, try the Millennium Bridge for a shorter loop or the Battersea for a longer run.

Enjoy a bit of nature in the middle of the city as you glide along shaded paths, past ponds, gardens, and of course Kensington Palace. Any number of routes are possible through the Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens pathways, which offer a combination of paved and dirt surfaces. Our route adds on Green Park and St. James Park as well to take you past Buckingham Palace, the Horse Guards Parade, and the Mall. This route is flat and nearly traffic free except Hyde Park Corner. Note that Kensington Gardens is closed after dark.

Hampstead Heath is crisscrossed with both paved and dirt paths through woodlands and grassy knolls. It is a popular place for hill workouts up Parliament Hill, which has amazing views of the city. The Heath is an excellent place for an outdoor workout as it boasts a variety of terrain as well as an athletic track and swimming in the lido or ponds. This route takes you around the perimeter of the Heath and starts at the track where there are public shower facilities. After this short loop why not finish your run with some hill repeats on Parliament Hill?.

Richmond Park, the largest of the Royal Parks, is a countryside treasure within the city of London. A short trip from central London has you running on hilly dirt trails through forests and fields. The most popular route in Richmond Park is the perimeter loop on the Tamsin Trail but a network of trails offer countless options. If you venture in to the heart of the park you will likely meet some of the deer that live there. Toilets, water fountains and cafes are plentiful, making Richmond Park the ideal place for any type of run. Our route starts and finishes at the Roehampton Gate where you will find a café for a post-run snack. For a more formal lunch try the Pembroke Lodge.

This mostly traffic-free, flat, paved route takes you on a tour of East London via four different towpaths along London’s historic canals – the Limehouse Cut, River Lea, Hertford Union and Regent\'s Canals. Starting from the redeveloped Limehouse Basin you will run past narrowboats and locks, over and under bridges and even get a peek at the Olympic Park. You’ll find a variety of scenery along your way from industrial buildings to manicured parks. Highlights include the floating towpath on the Limehouse Cut, the Olympic Stadium, Victoria Park, and Mile End Park. You might try a detour through the meandering paths of Mile End Park or extend this route by continuing along the Thames.

Once a hunting ground for Henry VIII, today Regent’s Park is a public playground featuring open fields, gardens, a running track, restrooms, cafés, and the London Zoo. The paved paths through beautiful Regent\'s Park are a great place for a flat tempo run but we also like to run up Primrose Hill which some say rivals Parliament Hill for views of London. We start and finish this run near the Hub, which has locker and shower facilities, a café, and even offers exercise classes if you want to spice up your training.
East London - North of the river

Enjoy this nearly traffic-free run as you loop through the popular, historic Victoria Park. “Vicky Park”, as it is known locally, boasts pretty, tree-lined, paved paths, as well as restrooms, cafés, and plenty of other runners. After a lap around the park we add on an out and back along Regent\'s Canal to the arched Acton Mews Bridge. The towpath alongside Regent’s Canal is also a popular place for running in London as it allows you to run off-road for over 14 km from Little Venice to Limehouse Basin. Our route starts from the Crown Gates where you will find the Pavilion Café if you are in need of refreshment after your run.

Prior to the opening of Battersea Park in 1854 this area was known as Battersea Fields and was home to various lewd and lascivious activities. Now it is an elegant green space along the Thames that is popular with local runners. The 3 km, flat, paved Carriage Drive loop around Battersea Park and the running track at Millennium Arena are both excellent locations for your weekly speed work. In addition to the 8-lane track, Millennium Arena offers 19 tennis courts and a fitness centre complete with exercise classes and shower and changing facilities.
Based at Southwark Athletics Centre, affiliated to England Athletics. A friendly, inclusive club offering opportunities for athletes and runners of all levels.
Millennium Arena, Battersea Park & other tracks

Belgrave Harriers was founded over one hundred years ago in 1887 and has a long and rich history of success in athletics and running. We pride ourselves on being an all inclusive club and cater to all standards and ranges of ability. We offer coaching, training and competitions in all track and field, road running, cross-country, indoor athletics and race walking events and welcome athletes from the age of 11 upwards that are interested in the sport. levels.

This club has grown very fast, and proved that there\'re plenty of eager runners in Clapham! They are a very friendly bunch and not in the least intimidating. As such we\'d highly recommend them for beginners, but they're not short on speedy Gonzales either, so if you're looking for good competition this could well be the club for you.

The larger of the two Dulwich based clubs, this is also the more diverse, catering for all athletic disciplines. Dulwich produce strong performances in competition, especially on road, and they have good Vets runners. Friendly, with a broad range of abilities and depth in coaching, this is a very strong club.
A West London club that\'s great for juniors, and everyone else! There\'s plenty of diversity and a good base of knowledge and training advice within its members.

This is a friendly and diverse running club, very welcoming and with a good structure to offer support to runners of all levels and abilities. If you\'re looking to reach a new level or new distance, or just some encouragement and company in your running then this is a great club. Whilst the club is not strictly geared up for absolute beginners, they do work with some Run England sessions, so you can start there and then move into the club proper.

Harrow AC is the premier athletics club in the Harrow area with teams competing in the British, Southern and Youth Development Leagues. We have a very proud tradition of coaching and development within our community resulting in our athletes representing Team GB in both the Olympics and at the World Championships. We very much see Athlete development as a Core principle of H.A.C and helping an athlete to be "As Good As They Can Possibly Be" and achieving their "Personal Best" sits at the very heart of everything we want to achieve.

A South London club with a great juniors section, very strong on track training (for all ages!), but with experience in everything up to Ultra Distance. They have great coaches, a lovely mix of ages from an enthusiastic team of youngsters to vets who've been running many a decade. A well organized and diverse club who regularly feature in the medals.

The club is based at the Parliament Hill athletics track on the south side of Hampstead Heath, and with nearly 800 acres of undulating heathland on which to train, has developed a strong tradition in cross country running. Highgate Harriers welcomes new members of all standards and abilities from the age of seven. Just come along to the track and join in with one of the training sessions.

The objective of Hillingdon AC is \'to give every member the opportunity to train and participate at his and her best level, in a professional and happy environment and be recognised locally as such a club".
We pride ourselves on being a friendly, open club with an active social section throughout the year for all age groups. The Club has around 500 paid up members of which almost half are under 21. The Club is open to individuals of all ages and ability and currently provides competition in track, field, road and cross country from 11 years of age up to 70+.
New members are welcome throughout the year from juniors through to veterans whatever your abilities.

London Heathside is a friendly community athletics club that warmly welcomes runners and athletes of all standards and ages. We always promote participation and excellence in road running, track and field athletics and cross country running. We train from a number of local venues and are the natural home for runners and track & field athletes in boroughs of: Haringey, Camden, Islington and Hackney. Our members compete in cross-country races throughout the winter, track and field athletics in the spring and summer and road racing year round. Each year we have upwards of 40 members who train for and complete in the Virgin London Marathon and regularly appear within the top six clubs for this event. We organise regular athletics, cross-country and road racing events. We enjoy many community and school links. With over 400 members, including approximately 100 young athletes, you will always find someone at your level to train with. The club also has a lively social scene!

Athletes of all standards are invited to join this all inclusive club. We are an open club, and welcome members of all abilities, gender, disability and ethnicity. The club welcomes prospective athletes from the age of eight years and upwards offering the opportunity to train and compete. You are not required to join in the first place, as we offer the opportunity to sample the club for £3 a session. It is however necessary to join before being able to compete for the club.
Battersea Track, Seymour Leisure Centre amongst others

Serpentine is possibly the largest running and triathlon club in Britain. We have 2245 members of whom 43% are women. We have a wide variation of ages: a few juniors, many young people, a few in their eighties and everything in-between. However, although we are large, we like to think we retain a friendly, small club atmosphere and always welcome newcomers. Our roots were in road running but these days our members take part in all sorts of sporting activities loosely related to running. We compete in road races all year round. Additionally, in the winter we also do cross country, taking part in two leagues, as well as in County and National Championships; and in summer, we have men's and women's track & field teams in the Southern Athletics League, the vets league, and the Rosenheim league. The other major focus in summer of course is triathlon and duathlon racing, with members competing at every distance (in fact several hundred club members only ever compete in multi-sport). We have several members who have competed at international level for England and other nations in running, track & field, duathlon and triathlon competitions.

Shaftesbury cater for athletes of all ages from 10 years upwards, competing in Track and Field Athletics, Cross-Country and Road Running. We are involved at all levels of Athletics within the Community. As well as providing coaching for athletes from Novices to Olympic Standard, we provide teams to help out at the London Marathon, encourage schools to link in with us, arrange meetings at which International Athletes compete. A Primary Schools Club operates from Copthall Girls School, Pursley Road, Mill Hill Shaftesbury are a Community Club catering for all levels of athlete - all we ask for is regular attendance and a commitment to training.

Membership is available to anyone from the age of 11 years up and everyone can benefit from coaching suitable to them. St Mary\'s Richmond AC provides competition opportunities for our members throughout the year, and actively encourages the membership to compete in order to realise their goals and achieve their full potential.

All standards are catered for and everyone will be made most welcome. In order to encourage runners of all abilities, the club has had a long standing policy of frequently \'turning back\' to pick up those running at the back of the pack. If you have any doubts about whether you can keep up with the pace, or of dropping off the back and getting lost, fear not, we won't leave you behind! If you are interested in joining us come along to one of our sessions and speak to whoever is leading the run. You are welcome to run with us for a few weeks before formally joining and paying your subscription

We train at Linford Christie Stadium, West London, which is situated at the back of Hammersmith Hospital on Wormwood Scrubs and we have our own Club House at trackside plus a Cross Country course around Wormwood Scrubs. Thames Valley Harriers caters for every standard, from beginners to Olympic Champions, and also offers a full coaching programme. All ages, both male and female, from 11 to 99 years are welcome and we compete at all levels on the Road, Cross Country, and on Track & Field. If you are looking for more gentle activity, we also have a joggers group.
Victoria Park Harriers & Tower Hamlets AC

Based out of St. Augustine\'s Hall in the north-east corner of Victoria Park, east London. The club is open to all, regardless of ability, from the age of 9 upwards. The membership of approximately 400 includes track, field, road and cross country athletes, from beginners to GB team members. Coached training sessions occur at both St. Augustine\'s Hall and Mile End Stadium several times a week. The Clubhouse is open five days a week and its use is free to all full Club members. The Clubhouse is located on the edge of Victoria Park giving direct access to the traffic-free running environment provided by the Park, the local canal towpaths, Hackney Marshes and the River Lea towpath. In addition, the Club uses the 8-lane, floodlit track at Mile End Stadium, Rhodeswell Road for track and field training.
